## Discussion

You don’t typically create an instance of [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/AnimationState] directly. Instead, the [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/AnimationContext] provides the animation state to an instance of [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/CustomAnimation].

# init()

**Initializer**

Create an empty state container.

## Declaration

```swift
init()
```

## Discussion

You don’t typically create an instance of [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/AnimationState] directly. Instead, the [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/AnimationContext] provides the animation state to an instance of [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/CustomAnimation].
title: init()
